content:
=== Game Rules ===
Game rules in natural language:
Here’s a plain‐language breakdown of the game:

1. Genre and Feel
 • It’s a puzzle–action adventure where you explore a maze-like, grid‑based level.
 • You must navigate through shifting terrain, clear obstacles, and dodge hazards while collecting valuable resources.
 • The game has elements similar to classic tile‐based puzzles or platformers, with arcade-style action and strategic planning.

2. Key Mechanics
 • You control an avatar that can “shoot” a pickaxe/sword – a tool used to break through dirt or eliminate obstacles.
 • The level contains various tiles like dirt (which you might need to clear), walls, and movable objects.
 • Diamonds are collectible resources that each add to your score; you’ll need to accumulate enough of them.
 • Boulders (falling hazards) and enemies (like random NPCs, crabs, and butterflies) clutter the level. They behave in predictable ways:
  – Boulders fall downward and can hurt you if you come into contact with them improperly (for instance, if you’re hit from the side rather than from above).
  – Some enemy interactions are even “mixed”: for example, if a butterfly contacts a crab, the butterfly might transform into a diamond, giving you extra points.
 • The environment reacts to your actions with “stepBack” effects and score changes when collisions occur (e.g., the avatar interacting with boulders under certain conditions subtracts points).

3. Objective and Win/Loss Conditions
 • Your main goal is to collect enough diamonds. The exit door won’t let you finish the level until you have – based on the rule – “if the avatar has more than 9 diamonds” when touching it, the door will open (in-game, this interaction “kills” the exitdoor sprite, which is the win condition).
 • You must also survive threats. Losing your avatar (running out of lives, essentially) results in a loss.
 • In short, collect at least the required number of diamonds, then go to the exit door to finish the level successfully.

4. Overall Strategy Tips
 • Focus on resource gathering early: Explore the level to collect diamonds while keeping a cautious eye on risk—flying boulders and wandering enemies can catch you off guard.
 • Use your pickaxe/sword wisely. It can clear dirt or eliminate obstacles and enemies, helping you create or clear paths. Timing your shots is essential.
 • Watch enemy behavior: Some enemy interactions can actually benefit you (for example, turning a butterfly into a diamond when it meets a crab), so use the environment to your advantage.
 • Move carefully around boulders. Since these objects can “kill” you if you’re hit from the wrong angle, plan your moves and anticipate falling hazards.
 • Once you’ve accumulated at least 10 diamonds (or more than 9, in the game’s logic), make your way to the exit door. Ensure you approach the door only when conditions are right, as the door only “goes away” (granting you victory) if you have the necessary resources.
 • Overall, remain patient and methodical: balance between exploring for resources, avoiding hazards, and efficiently clearing obstacles to reach the level’s end.

In summary, you’re navigating a challenging puzzle/action mixed environment where careful resource management and tactical movement are key. Stick to your plan—collect, clear, and safely reach the exit—and you’ll beat the level.

You are an intelligent player playing a video game, and you have a friend provide you strategy. Interpret the state, rule, strategy and act accordingly. Notice that your avatar position is one of the most important information, if the position doesn't change from the last state, you need to analyze the state and make a different action from the last time.

=== Available Actions ===
0: ACTION_NIL
1: ACTION_USE
2: ACTION_LEFT
3: ACTION_RIGHT
4: ACTION_DOWN
5: ACTION_UP

=== Important Mechanics Notice ===
 In some games, directional actions (LEFT, RIGHT, UP, DOWN) may first cause the avatar to rotate toward the intended direction without immediately moving. If the avatar's position does not change after a directional action, it may indicate a rotation has occurred. To proceed, you must apply the directional action again after rotation. Always verify whether the avatar actually moved after each action. Please understand the rule and the interaction set first, then locate the item, finally choose a meaningful action towards the win and respond in the format: ``` Action:<action number> ```. Include one sentence of feedback on the action and your expectation to see if it aligns with the strategy. Notice, Action 0 will not reasult in any change in this game environment, and you may need to understand the level layout first to play the game. 

=== Sprite Mapping ===
avatar -> 'a'
background dirt -> '.'
background -> '-'
background exitdoor -> 'e'
background boulder -> 'o'
background diamond -> 'x'
background crab -> 'c'
background butterfly -> 'b'
boulder -> '@'
butterfly -> '#'
crab -> '$'
diamond -> '%'
dirt -> '&'
exitdoor -> '*'
wall -> 'b'

I'm moving UP from my current position (6,7) to head towards the diamond at (4,7), following the strategy to collect resources early.
